reviews.review_msg: She teaches very SLOW and you may have some problems with chapters which remain for last week! but is very kind and has good behavior.

not sure why olga has such a low rating she is amazing. When you put in the work and show effort she will like you. The way she explains math makes it so easy to understand, may take long but she makes sure that you fully understand how to properly understand and solve equations. TAKE HER CLASSES

Ok so its basically grade 11 foundations and pre calc 11. Class time is for quizzes, and grouped problem solving...what does that mean? All "lectures" are in smaller classrooms and it feels like highschool. the content is identical to grade 11 math. in class you will make groups of 5 and solve word problems relating to that weeks chapter. free B

Despite FANX99 being a requirement course for many students who did not take highschool precalc, she was not equipped at all to explain basic concepts. Her lectures were bad and she often confused everyone, including herself. Half the class failed. When I retook it with a different prof I thrived (he knew how to teach). Avoid her at all costs.

She is TOO old to be teaching. She makes you take midterms and quizzes with no desk, forcing you to write on a mini white board sitting in the middle of the room on a rolly chair. Talks and teaching so slowly, does not explain material properly. Will not let you work with each other to understand things. Doesn't answer questions properly/ says no

She is so sweet but she can't teach the class, or hold its attention. We asked questions and she wouldn't explain it, but she would start again from the top instead of giving us a direct answer. Its also easier and faster to learn from friends and Youtube over this class.

professor that relies on students to teach each other instead of teaching the students herself, which is such a waste of time and money ($1000). They frequently double back on things they teach during lessons which makes understanding the material 10x more difficult than needed. horrible communication + horrible prof + horrible experience = -10/10

Ur paying a thousand dollars to have her teach nothing and say you understand the questions is cus you didn't study at home for 12 hours and watch the (bad) videos explaining the chapters. Super quiet and when she does teach it's not worth listening to because she doesn't understand what she is teaching stutters and doubles back on stuff she said.

literally cannot hear her. like half the class didnt pass the midterm. we were the only fan x99 class that did poorly so clearly this aint an us problem but a her problem. girly doesnt explain anything. if she does she repeats herself like three different times but it still doesnt make sense. we sit in class and do problems. thats it.

Take off so many marks on random parts of your answer even if you got it right and showed your work. She gets the class to teach each other rather than teaching her students. She is nice but doesn't teach anything that is on assignments or quizzes you have to learn it yourself.
hard to understand what she is teaching she makes this course so confusing. also told the class to "learn it yourself I don't have the time for that"

Olga was very helpful. She is one of the most caring prof's I've had. Her calm, cool and collected teaching style resulted in fear of math going away, and taught me to love math! She says after class to help anyone with any problem. I can't say enough good things about her. Very had class though so be prepared to spend a lot of time doing work.

Olga is a good professor and cares about her students. She wants everyone to be on the same page. I dont have a problem with her teaching, its more about how FANX99 is taught in general. This is my second time taking the class and shes much better than the professor I had before. If you have to take FAN, shes the best choice.
Olga was SUPER helpful and answered questions in and out of class time. She does have a pretty strong accent and speaks pretty quietly, so sit up front and ask questions!

I'm a liberal arts student who was forced and terrified to take FAN X99, but luckily, I got Olga as a prof. She cares about her students and wants them to pass her class, and she's great at clearly explaining math theory and application. If you're stuck on a problem, she is more than willing to help you sort it out from start to finish.

She's honestly a great teacher. She's the type of prof that wants her students to pass and will do anything to do so. Her quizzes and exams are relatively easy if you study the online textbook and pay attention in class. Personally, I thought her class was a great GPA booster. So yeah, I would definitely recommend her. BTW, she really loves cats!!!
